solution_line_template: Louise has already produced {total_cakes} cakes / {initial_baked_divisor} = <<{total_cakes}/{initial_baked_divisor}={initial_baked_cakes}>>{initial_baked_cakes} cakes.

After calculating how many cakes are left, she bakes another {cakes_left_after_initial_bake} cakes / {today_baked_divisor} = <<{cakes_left_after_initial_bake}/{today_baked_divisor}={today_baked_cakes}>>{today_baked_cakes} cakes.

The next day, she calculates again then bakes another {cakes_left_after_today_bake} cakes / {next_day_baked_divisor} = <<{cakes_left_after_today_bake}/{next_day_baked_divisor}={next_day_baked_cakes}>>{next_day_baked_cakes} cakes.

She therefore still needs to bake {total_cakes} - {initial_baked_cakes} - {today_baked_cakes} - {next_day_baked_cakes} = <<{total_cakes}-{initial_baked_cakes}-{today_baked_cakes}-{next_day_baked_cakes}={cakes_needed_to_bake}>>{cakes_needed_to_bake} cakes.
